definition: palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: A palace maid was killed for gossiping about the East Palace story.
sentences.chinese: 一个宫女就因私传东宫的事被杀了。

sentences.english: Then the king called in one hundred and eighty maids of honor and ordered Sun Wu to train them.
sentences.chinese: 于是吴王召来一百八十名宫女，命令孙武来训练她们。

sentences.english: I ’ve seen a palace maid beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 我就见过一个宫女被砍了头。

sentences.english: You hear more than a palace in the say so.
sentences.chinese: 你听见不止一个宫女在这样说。

sentences.english: That old maid-in-waiting immediately put ons the overshoe ses with the speed that same chase in the behind.
sentences.chinese: 那个老宫女立刻穿上套鞋，以同样的速度在后面追赶。

sentences.english: The maid replied that she couldn't prepare a dinner.
sentences.chinese: 这宫女回说，她不会做这样的一席菜。

sentences.english: Sun Wu organized the young ladies into two teams and appointed two of the king's favorite concubines team leaders.
sentences.chinese: 孙武将宫女分为两队，叫吴王的两个宠姬担任队长。

sentences.english: My maids and I will fast likewise.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的宫女也要这样禁食。

sentences.english: The Emperor readily agreed with him, and raised funds by selling the things left behind by deceased court maids.
sentences.chinese: 高宗欣然同意，并用死亡宫女的遗物资助玄奘建塔。

sentences.english: She is no more than a lowly maid of honor.
sentences.chinese: 她不过是一个卑微的宫女。

sentences.english: I and my maids will fast as you do.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的宫女也要这样禁食。

sentences.english: From when rise, her starting need not dress and red blood temple maid-in-waiting common raiment.
sentences.chinese: 从何时起，她开始不用穿和赤血宫宫女一般的衣服。

sentences.english: Why can you have 4 concubines, 121 talent ladies, and a thousand maids?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能有四个嫔妃，一百二十一个才人，成千的宫女？

sentences.english: My maids and I will do the same for three days.
sentences.chinese: 她和她的宫女也禁食和祷告三天。

definition: imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
